Robert, Lidia
Stradella, Agostina
Sullivan, Ivana
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To study lytic lesions in a patient with past history of renal cancer. METHODS A 62 year-old man was admitted to hospital for investigation of the cause of polyostotic bone pain. RESULTS Brown tumors due to hyperparathyroidism turned out to be the cause of bone pain. CONCLUSIONS Differential diagnosis is important in daily practice in order to provide a correct treatment for each condition.
metadata.dc:title: Lytic lesions in a patient with past history of renal cancer.
